website_summaries.verdict: Solid performance, multi-day battery life, and a gorgeous 6.4-inch display make the $249 Moto G Power the best budget-friendly phone you can buy right now.
pros: All networks bands for global usage

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: Having experience with the Moto G7 Power I thought I'd upgrade to this model and so far is have to say its good the camera takes better pictures than the other other model and the operating system is also good with some great new features will update this review after a month to explore the phone more
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Amazing battery but no NFC
customer_reviews.text: Nice Phone good screen, sound and photo quality. Amazing battery life and not weighted down with bloat wear, But no NFC support
customer_reviews.author: Izzydoob

customer_reviews.title: Incredible battery life
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone to replace my moto g6, and I'm not disappointed. It's a great smartphone, with a good camera setup and amazing battery. it lasts me two full days between recharging with average use. the phone feels well made and all the functions are easy to use. I love the fact that it comes with almost pure android and none of the mfr apps of other android phones. The sound is really good and I find the screen size and definition really good for watching TV / Sport. All in all a great phone at a budget price.
customer_reviews.author: John Stocker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent spec for the money. Upgraded from OnePlus 3t and the Moto G8 Power performs as well as that, but with some tech upgrades like the processor, dual cameras, speakers. I've had a Moto G4 before and my partner has a G7 Power. The whole series has been excellent. I forsee getting a good 3 or so years use out of this phone. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amie

customer_reviews.title: An impressive "budget" phone
customer_reviews.text: Really can't see why you would pay more for a smartphone. Looks good, phenomenal battery life and excellent camera. It does everything I need except one; it does not sync properly with my Huawei GT fitness tracker watch. My Old Moto 4 worked perfectly with the GT but this one no. Have tried everything , it recognises the watch, pairs tells me steps but none of the more sophisticated functions like workout, sleep tracker etc. Otherwise can't fault it.
customer_reviews.author: Hotwired

customer_reviews.title: Almost the perfect phone
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to try and keep this short as nobody wants to read a book when looking at a review. This phone doesn't do anything amazing and doesn't exceed in anything. What it DOES do is bring a very balanced feature set that it does just right. You won't get an amazong camera or amazing sound, but what you do get is something that is more than good enough for the average person. This is hoenstly the best phone i've ever had, and i've had more than 30 in my lifetime. It would've got 5/5 if it wasn't for the fact it doesn't have NFC on this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Martin-Worth

customer_reviews.title: Battery class - Comparion v S7 Edge
customer_reviews.text: Ever since my iPhone 6 battery completely died I've always thought about phones with good battery. I had S7 Edge with good battery, but the G8 Power is insane. You can literally go out the house in the morning with 40% and make it home without it dying. Everything on it is fine, but I think the camera is poor compared to my S7 Edge, which is a shame given the S7 is at least 4 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Brow

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: No shame to my old Moto C, but it's like night and day. Easy to set up out of the box and transferring everything (well nearly everything) from my old phone was seamless. Nice to hold and I find the clear cover a bonus. It saves you getting finger marks all over the back and it grips nicely in the hand. It does everything I need and more, quickly and efficiently. Great phone for the money.
customer_reviews.author: P ROSS

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Same size as my G6 plus but the things on the front such as the fingerprint reader is now on the rear leaving all the front as screen. Similar to G6 plus re usage but several new features. Just had it and getting used to it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tony H

customer_reviews.title: Great Mobile, Budget Price!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to the G8 from a G3, so I was going to be impressed strait out of the blocks. However, now having used the G8 for a number of weeks, I'm impressed with the battery and the screen. Screen PPI is very high and it's a real pleasure to view and is easy on the eye. Camera takes good photos - good enough for me and the family album. I've always found the Moto G phones to be practical and great quality for a budget mobile. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: GRG Cambridge

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Secondary Phone for Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: Amazing battery life. Stereo speakers with solid sound even under loud volume. Good enough GPU for gaming. Clever design of punch hole camera location for full screen video watching experience. Keeping 3.5mm jack with FM radio receiver is nice. Four cameras are not outstanding but still playful. Price tag perfect. So good that OS version is the latest Android 10. I use it as a secondary phone, missing NFC is not my concern.
customer_reviews.author: LAM

customer_reviews.title: Good phone.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't expecting a super phone when I got this. I just needed a phone and this one had acceptable reviews. It has a decent standard camera, but a not so god frontal camera... Battery life is not bad, lasts about 1 day which is what we need, so no problem. It is not the quickest of the phones and it will get saturated quite often if you have a lot of things open in the background, but if you shut them and let the phone think for a sec. it will be all good. If you need a quick fix this will definitely do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good Phone for money....BUT
customer_reviews.text: Phone overall is good for the money with Android 10 & comes with a cover. I was aware that it doesn't have NFC (which I can do without), BUT really this phone DOES NOT operate on 5Ghz wifi!!! In this day and age, modern tech should have at least both. If fast download is important to you then note this phone operates ONLY on 2.4GHz. Seems you have to really look at specs, I did see wifi b/g/n, but not the wifi frequency! Considering whether to return or not :-(
customer_reviews.author: markm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Phone For The Price
customer_reviews.text: The battery on this phone is excellent (normally 2-3 days on 1 charge), a few months into owning and its still holding up like a trooper where other phones normally dip off a bit. Build quality is great and has held up well to normal everyday wear and tear given I do not use any screen protector or cases. It's responsive and I have had no issues with it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Penketh

customer_reviews.title: Best price/quality ratio I've ever seen in a phone
customer_reviews.text: This smartphone has all of the features I would expect in a flagship device for a fraction of the price. The aspects I'm most impressed about are its very long battery life and its high screen-to-body ratio. Motorola have really outdone themselves with this phone, it cannot be more rounded off than it is! I'd definitely recommend it to anyone looking to buy a versatile phone who don't want to pay the (IMHO oftentimes unjustified) premium of a high-end device.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Best phone for the money 2020
customer_reviews.text: Am writing this review using the device rn. Had some issues transferring data over, however the device looks great hasn't scratched at all yet battery charges fully inside an hour and lasts about a day and a half under use. Handsfree and speakers seem better than any other phone ive had yet and the screen is great although on some videos you will notice the selfie cam a little as a black dot in your screen
customer_reviews.author: R-B

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. I had the G7, which was one of the best phones I've ever owned. After it had an unfortunate accident with some oven cleaner this model was a no brainer. I'm comparison to the G7 the battery life is appalling. Needs charging ever day, without fail. My G7 would easily last 3 days without a charge, with this phone (this is the power version) you can literally see the battery drain in front of you. Appreciate its software related but the phone jams and freezes all the time, particularly when using Chrome. Rather unhappy with my purchase. I'd pay £££ to swap it for a G7.
customer_reviews.author: Jim John Jones

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good, Bargain Price
customer_reviews.text: So if you're a mega gamer or like to have 5000 apps on the go, this is not the one for you. But if you need a few apps, internet, WhatsApp and obviously calls etc then it's really good and for the price it's amazing. Can freeze a little bit for a few seconds while browsing but versus my last phone that cost £600 and I dropped in the toilet... For a third of the price the phone is almost as good for my purposes. Battery lasts forever.
customer_reviews.author: MISS G H KIBBLEWHITE

customer_reviews.title: Only 2.4ghz wifi.
customer_reviews.text: 2020 only 2.4ghz wifi, waste of time, didn't even think this would have been a thing.
customer_reviews.author: P J Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if its a design fault
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it is a design fault but the same thing occurred again. Ear phone socket tempremental. Nearly returned earphones brought from you. Also the screen kept locking had to really push or prod hard for it sometimes to move.The sensitivity of the screen was aother issue. Kept doing what it wanted even when the head set cable passed on the phone; did adjust on phone; same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Cynthia Renee

customer_reviews.title: G6 almost as good
customer_reviews.text: This is a bog standard G range mobile. It has little to recommend it over the G6; it is a little larger and a bit lumpen in the hand. It is also quite weighty. The cameras take some getting used to and the G6 took better pics with less effort. All the features work as they should and if you are a Moto convert it is very easy to set up. Basically it is an unexciting, boring mobile. Sorry Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Shazzer

customer_reviews.title: "Cheap " and very cheerful
customer_reviews.text: Battery life stunning. Runs latest Android 10. Does all the basics without issue. Sure you could £100s more but would that be money well spent...I doubt it. The phone is a little heavier than previous ones I've had and also a little bigger but these features are not deal breakers. More than happy with purchase (so far!).
customer_reviews.author: A. N. Other

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life and price.Camera not so good.
customer_reviews.text: My Moto g5s got damaged,so bought this phone to treat myself.great price,and great battery life. Overall impressed for the money,but am disappointed in the camera quality,my G5 was better quality.so hence my drop in a star rating

I am very satisfied with this phone.

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: My previous Moto G5 was great, but the battery was struggling to last a day. Now, with the same usage, I am only having to charge the G8 Power every 6 days.

Has all the features of a premium smartphone too, and does the job the very best without any problems :)

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic budget smartphone.

customer_reviews.text: Fantastic battery life easy to navigate great overall value for the money

customer_reviews.title: valuable item

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap phone.  Pleased with it.

customer_reviews.title: Great battery
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life. I am a light phone user and the battery is lasting 3-4 days. Would have liked a 5GHz WiFi
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: A step backwards in terms of screen time and software
customer_reviews.text: I just came from a Moto g power 7 and before that a Moto G6 Amazon edition and this thing is awful. Half baked software clearly rushed to market or just an after thought. My unit is getting 7 hours average screen time vs 12 on my Power 7. The video is awful instead of using the main camera for video it seems to be using the portrait lens so it looks worse than it does on the g7. Every issue I've had could be fixed with software but until these issues are acknowledged and fixed this phone is untouchable in my opinion a step backwards.
customer_reviews.author: arron.stepan

customer_reviews.title: Great phone that doesn't disappoint
customer_reviews.text: Great phone and a fab price. Very easy to use especially for a technophobe like me. Battery charges really quickly and lasts for 3ish days. The camera is great although it can do far more than I'm capable of 😂 I'm no photographer but with this phone I've been able to take cracking shots like the ones above.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: This phone is Gr8!
customer_reviews.text: I have been really happy with my Moto G6, but decided the time was right to upgrade . I wont go into all the details, there are plenty of pro reviews out there , for me the main draws were the camera , the battery life, better speakers and the bigger phone size. All were as expected , esp pleased with the wide angle camera on the rear , and the substantial extra settings, inc manual, over the G6 . If you have a G6 it is well worth the upgrade to this phone, in my opinion. For the money, not sure how you could possibly not give this phone 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Kev

customer_reviews.title: Camera Fault
customer_reviews.text: Phone worked fine for first few days. Then camera failed. Turn on camera app, the screen now blank/black, icons for the camera app all there but non functioning. Screen frozen. Needed to turn phone off and back on. Camera seemed to now work OK, But later when opening up camera app was created with the same frozen black screen. Its as if the camera is not sending any data to the phone and the screen then freezes. Did a check online and found the exact same issue on a forum which ended up in "its a hardware fault return for service" or sum such words. Phone returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mark55

customer_reviews.title: Excellent £200 phone .
customer_reviews.text: I've had all the Moto series since they came out . This unsurprisingly is an improved and evolved G8 . Fast and runs everything I need to run on a phone. Don't share the camera gripes expressed by othe reviews. Pics are sharp and colours good . Apart from slightly skimpy 64gb it's at least as good as a Samsung a70 I've used . I could have used a slightly bigger screen option and storage option . I can't keep excess apps on the SD card as per other Android handsets . The huge battery can do 2 days . Excellent £200 phone .
customer_reviews.author: Tedders

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good phone for what it costs. The battery can last from around 2 to 4 days depending on how much the device is used. This would be it's standout feature. The camera works just fine and produces clear photos in most situations. Beware that the screen is not an amoled display meaning the colours are neutral and not vibrant. But, otherwise the clarity is good. The colour or lack of it is not an issue for me, but may be for someone. Included in the box is a clear flexible cover that protects the back and edges of the phone. Nothing fancy just functional.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent battery life, a couple of bugs, and one major flaw
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is amazing, and the phone is fast and responsive, with a nice quality screen. Problems I've had so far: 1. With the 3.5mm jack, for some reason my music turns down randomly every few minutes when I'm on my motorbike. 2. No 5ghz wifi - this is something I had no idea about when I bought the phone unfortunately, but it means I can't connect to the wifi at work, where there is very little mobile signal. The second point there would have been a deal breaker for me had I known in advance, and really lets the phone down. For that reason, I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Grove

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant Moto!
customer_reviews.text: After owning the excellent G7 Power, I wondered just how much better the sequel would be. It's better in every possible way! Can't recommend it enough.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for that price

It's still early days but I hope it is durable and lasts a long time.

I have had Motorola phones before but this one excels with the long battery life and ease of use. I bought it for the camera and it doesn't disappoint. A great phone for the money.

product_meta.title: Motorola Moto G8 power 6.4 Inch FHD+ zero-notch display, Qualcomm Snapdragon SD665, 16MP main camera, 2MP macro camera, 5000 mAH battery, Dual SIM, 4/64GB, Android 10, Smoke Black
product_meta.description: Colour Name:Smoke BlackExperience the power to be your creative best. Say hello to moto g8 power. With its 5000 mAh battery, you can go up to three full days on a single charge—and do the things you want without worrying about recharging. Shoot photos from close up, far away, or anywhere in between with an AI-powered quad camera system. And thanks to the 6.4” Max Vision Full HD+ display and dual stereo speakers tuned by Dolby, you’ll have an all-access pass to the world of entertainment. New moto g8 power. Unplug. Unleash. Advanced water-repellent design. Never let spills, splashes, or a little sweat get in the way of using your phone.
feature_bullets: Up to three days of battery life on a single charge thanks to the massive 5000 mAh battery.
AI-powered quad camera system. Unleash your creativity whether shooting from a distance, wide angle, or extremely close up.
Dual Stereo Speakers tuned by Dolby. Enjoy 4x more crystal-clear audio that’s 4x more powerful with dual stereo speakers tuned by Dolby.
Max Vision display. Bring games and movies to life on a vivid 6.4" Full HD+ display.
Blazing-fast performance. Feel your phone respond to every touch, tap, and swipe with an octa-core processor and 4 GB of RAM.
